newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - Feb 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - Feb 21.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Five West African presidents from countries of the Entente Council vow at meeting in Ivory Coast's political capital Yamoussoukro to work towards solidarity, peace and security.
- National Union of Students, Pupils and Parents supports idea of a security force on university campuses to protect people and property following recent unrest at colleges.
- Ivory Coast commercial capital Abidjan to acquire two special boats to clean up its lagoons.
- Opposition Ivorian Popular Front party and Republican Rally seek common strategy to confront government.
- Ivory Coast phone company CI-Telcom informs the public its network is experiencing some disruptions on international communications due to a faulty submarine cable.
- Regional summit in Yamoussoukro deplores conflict in Central Africa; pledges to work for integration.
